metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24806 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow and out of bounds memory access

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.7').
